intro: Crotonogyne soyauxii, commonly known as the African croton, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, yellowish-green inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Crotonogyne soyauxii is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its foliage and floral display.
